August 14, 2013S. Maad Jahangir Reading time ~1 minute

PostgreSQL useful commands

So i was working on PostgreSQL and collected few commands for assistance in future. This is basic commands that can help MySQL user to get started.

PostgreSQL is accessible by only postgres user (by default) so you have to use sudo with every command executing from root user.

 

Entering PSQL prompt/Command line : sudo -u postgres psql

 

Get a list of databases in Postgres:
From shell prompt : sudo -u postgres psql -l
From PSQL prompt : \l [Note: This is backslash followed by lower-case L]

 

Create a Database in PostgreSQL:
From shell prompt : sudo -u postgres createdb testdb
From PSQL prompt : CREATE DATABASE testdb

 

Delete/Drop a Database in PostgreSQL:
From shell prompt : sudo -u postgres dropdb testdb
From PSQL prompt : DROP DATABASE testdb

 

Backup/Dump a Database in PostgreSQL:
From shell prompt : sudo -u postgres pg_dump testdb > backup.out

 

Restore a Database in PostgreSQL:
From Shell Prompt : sudo -u postgres psql -f backup.out testdb

 

Other usefull command from PSQL prompt:
Selecting Database : \c testdb
Getting List of tables : \d OR \dt
Exiting PSQL prompt : \q
Getting Help : \? OR \h OR \h CREATE

 

Hope this will help.

Tags: SMJ, blog, Maad •
July 15, 2013S. Maad Jahangir  •  Comment Reading time ~1 minute

Delete SSL certificates from Amazon account

I was working on AWS ELB's and faced issue when uploading SSL certificate on ELB. Found out that by default AWS ELB can only hold 10 SSL certificates and if you exceed this value, It will throw an quota exceed error. So i have to delete few of the old to ones to continue.

You cannot delete amazon SSL certificates through GUI. Amazon API tools is required for this task.

Download the IAMCli utilities from amazon and untar it in /root

export AWS_IAM_HOME=/root/IAMCli-1.2.0/

List the available SSL certificates in the account. (If you get Java Error then export Java Home path too)

# /root/IAMCli-1.2.0/bin/iam-servercertlistbypath  –aws-credential-file  /root/my-account-creds.txt
arn:aws:iam::609154335954:server-certificate/answerable-com-lb-ssl-cert
arn:aws:iam::609154335954:server-certificate/cdn-olokiran-certif
arn:aws:iam::609154335954:server-certificate/cert
arn:aws:iam::609154335954:server-certificate/dsp-olokiran-com-cert
arn:aws:iam::609154335954:server-certificate/ostk-kik

Delete the unwanted certificate using the following command

/root/IAMCli-1.2.0/bin/iam-servercertdel –aws-credential-file my-account-creds.txt  -s dsp-olokiran-com-cert

where

# cat /root/my-account-creds.txt
AWSAccessKeyId=XXXXXXXXX
AWSSecretKey=xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
